to.networld.schandler.card
Class Mifare1K

java.lang.Object
  to.networld.schandler.card.AbstractCard
      to.networld.schandler.card.Mifare1K

public class Mifare1K
extends AbstractCard

PC/SC 2.0 - Mifare Command APDU:

| 1 Byte | 1 Byte | 1 Byte | 1 Byte | 1 Byte | x Byte | 1 Byte |
|---------------------------------------------------------------------|
| CLA | INS | P1 | P2 | Lc | Data in | Le |

Lc ... The length of the "Data in" field.

Response APDU:

| x Byte | 1 Byte | 1 Byte |
----------------------------------------|
| Data out | SW2 | SW1 |

Author:
Alex Oberhauser

STD_KEY

public static final byte[] STD_KEY
The following part is the standard key for Mifare Classic 1K cards. XXX: Wrong key! The right key for Mifare 1K cards is: FF FF FF FF FF FF

sectorLogin

public javax.smartcardio.ResponseAPDU sectorLogin(byte _keyType,
                                                  byte[] _key,
                                                  byte _accessStart,
                                                  byte _accessEnd,
                                                  byte _keyNumber)
                                           throws Exception
1. Load the key into the memory.
2. Authenticate with the previously loaded key.

The following example reads from a Mikare 1K card with standard key the first line:

  • _keyType = 0x60
  • _key = 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF
  • _accessStart = 0x00
  • _accessEnd = 0x00
  • _keyNumber = 0x01

Parameters:
_keyType - Could be 0x60 for KeyA or 0x61 for KeyB
_key - The key as byte array
_accessStart - The beginning of the area that is accessed.
_accessEnd - The end of the area that is accessed.
_keyNumber - 0x01, 0x1A, 0x1B should work as key number.
Returns:
A ResponseAPDU from the load key or authenticate phase.
Throws:
Exception

readData

public javax.smartcardio.ResponseAPDU readData(byte _keyType,
                                               byte[] _key,
                                               byte _accessStart,
                                               byte _accessEnd,
                                               byte _keyNumber)
                                        throws Exception
1. Load the key into the memory.
2. Authenticate with the previously loaded key.
3. Read data from the card The following example should work with a new Mifare 1K card:

  • _keyType = 0x60
  • _key = 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF
  • _accessStart = 0x00
  • _accessEnd = 0x00
  • _keyNumber = 0x01

Parameters:
_keyType - Could be 0x60 for KeyA or 0x61 for KeyB
_key - The key as byte array
_accessStart - The beginning of the area that is accessed.
_accessEnd - The end of the area that is accessed.
_keyNumber - 0x01, 0x1A, 0x1B should work as key number.
Returns:
If no error had occurred the data from the card.
Throws:
Exception
